text.section: In this section, "binder" means a binder or other temporary contract of insurance as provided under § 12-106 of the Insurance Article.

A credit grantor shall comply with this section if the credit grantor:
Makes any loan secured by a first lien on any interest in owner-occupied residential real property; and
As a condition of making the loan, requires the consumer borrower to purchase property insurance or credit loss insurance.

This section does not prohibit a credit grantor from refusing to honor a binder in cases where:
The credit grantor receives notice of the cancellation of the binder by the insurer; or
At the expiration of 30 days of the date the binder was given, the insurer has failed to issue the policy of insurance.
